access.notes: Landing page has Elementor accordion labeled 'EHI Export Documentation' linking to dev.azaleahealth.com/compliance/b10. That page links to platform-specific export guides.

export_format.description: Export uses FHIR R4 Bulk Data Export. Files are NDJSON format, one file per FHIR resource type. File naming: {resource}_{identifier}.ndjson. Unstructured data (images, documents, notes) included as base64-encoded Binary resources or inline in DocumentReference.content.attachment.data. Single patient export via UI or API with _typeFilter; population export via support request or Bulk Data API.

documentation.notes: Documentation is concept-to-FHIR-resource mapping tables. Shows which EHR concepts map to which FHIR resource types and includes FHIRPath-style filtering notes (e.g., Condition.where(category.coding.code = 'encounter-diagnosis')). Does NOT provide field-level detail, data types, or value sets. The FHIR R4 spec itself defines the schema — no custom schema is documented.

clinical.evidence: Ambulatory: Allergies, Care Plans, Conditions (encounter-diagnosis, health-concern, problem-list), Encounter (Clinical), Immunizations, Laboratory Orders/Reports/Results, Medications, Prescriptions, Procedures, Vital Signs, Smoking Status, Social History, Family History, Implantable Devices. Hospital: Admissions, Allergies, Diagnoses, Flowsheets, EMAR, Medication History/Orders, Vital Signs, Cardiology Orders/Execution, Therapy Orders/Execution, Nursing Orders.

secure_messages.evidence: Both platforms: 'Patient Portal Messages' mapped to Communication resource. Filter: Communication.where(sender.type = 'Patient') or Communication.where(recipient.type = 'Patient'). Hospital also has 'Amendments' mapped to Communication.

billing_financial.evidence: Ambulatory: Encounter (Billing) -> Claim, Encounter Financial Account -> Account (charge-group), Patient Financial Account -> Account (financial-account), Patient Statements -> Invoice, Payments (Applied + Unapplied) -> PaymentReconciliation, Pre-Certifications -> Claim (preauthorization). Hospital: Financial Account -> Account, Payments -> PaymentReconciliation.

insurance_coverage.evidence: Ambulatory: Insurance -> Coverage resource. Hospital: no explicit Insurance/Coverage mapping found.

documents_images.evidence: Ambulatory: Documents, Patient Documents, Chart Plan Note, Chart Procedure Note, Chart Subjective (PMH) Note, Patient Handouts, Patient Urls -> DocumentReference. Hospital: Chart Notes (All), Files -> DocumentReference. Both: Binary resources for unstructured data (base64-encoded). b10 overview explicitly states 'EHI also covers unstructured documents... such as images, documents, or medical notes.'

audit_trails.evidence: Searched for audit, access log, tracking, provenance in all export guide pages. No audit trail or access log resources are listed in the export mappings. Hospital resources page lists Provenance as a supported FHIR resource, but it is NOT listed in the EHI export guide mappings.

developer_guide_details: Full developer portal at dev.azaleahealth.com with Getting Started guide, SMART App Launch implementation guides, Bulk Data Access/Export guides, Capability Statements, and endpoint documentation.
issues: No field-level documentation: maps EHR concepts to FHIR resource types but does not document individual fields, data types, or value sets. Relies on standard FHIR R4 resource definitions.
Hospital platform lacks explicit Insurance/Coverage mapping — ambulatory has it.
No audit trail data in export — Provenance resource exists in the platform but is not included in EHI export mappings.
No sample export files or test data available.
Population export requires contacting support ('users requiring a patient population export must contact support to initiate the request').
summary: Azalea Health exports EHI as FHIR R4 NDJSON files via Bulk Data Export API. The ambulatory platform maps 57 EHR concepts to 30 FHIR resource types; the hospital platform maps 45 concepts to 24 resource types (34 unique across both). Coverage is strong for clinical data, billing (Claim, Account, Invoice, PaymentReconciliation), portal messages (Communication), appointments, and documents/images (including base64-encoded Binary resources). Insurance coverage is only in ambulatory. Audit trails are not exported. Documentation is concept-level mapping tables — no field-level schema is provided beyond standard FHIR R4 definitions.
